fields.description:
Epic Still Show on the Suggested List on the Epic Link despite Being Closed and Marked as Done.

*Expected Behavior*

No longer appear in the suggested list when the Epic is being marked as done

*Current Behavior*

Despite the Epic is being marked as done on the Agile board. Creating a new issue and clicking on the Epic Link, it will still suggested the closed Epic.

fields.summary: Epic Still Show on the Suggested List on the Epic Link despite Being Closed and Marked as Done

fields.description:
JIRA Agile assumes that the statuses in the left-most column equate to Not Started and the statuses in the right-most column equate to Done. A more flexible implementation would allow us to use checkboxes when configuring our boards to indicate which column(s) are Not Started columns and which column(s) are Done columns.

For example, we use a four-step workflow for stories (Not Started->In Progress->In Review->Done). We also have the additional states of Blocked and Dropped which can be transitioned to from any state.

I'd like to set my Scrum Board up with six columns in this order (Not Started, In Progress, In Review, Done, Blocked, Dropped). But Done and Dropped need to share the last column--otherwise we have problems closing Sprints with a mixture of done and dropped stories or sub-tasks. When Done and Dropped share the last column, there is no visual indication the story (or task) is Done or Dropped unless the details of the story (or task) are inspected. Even worse, we had to allow transition of stories to Done from any state to match the transition to Dropped from any state. Otherwise, a user might attempt to drag a story from In Progress to Done (skipping In Review) and JIRA Agile would silently put it in Dropped state (since there is no legal transition from In Progress to Done).

On the left-side of the board, if I put Blocked to the left of Not Started, JIRA Agile counts my Not Started stories as In Progress when looking at the story point accumulation, which is incorrect.
fields.summary: As the configurer of an agile board, I want to indicate which columns are "Not Started" columns and which columns are "Done" columns

fields.description:
As a scrum master (or product owner) I want to understand WHY scope changed during development of a release.

The Release Burndown report helpfully shows scope changes as "added to version" (see attached screenshot), but leaves me to manually figure out what was added or edited to result in that change.

Suggested solutions:
# turn the caption "added to version" into a link to the issues that caused the version scope to change. This would greatly reduce the effort required to understand why scope changed.
# add a list of the JIRA issues numbers which were added/edited to cause the scope that was added to the version.
fields.summary: Version Scope change on the Release Burndown report (added to version) should provide link to issues added/edited

fields.description:
Description of the BUG here: 
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/9870703

Hours not summed up correctly:

Furthermore on the top of the page there are 3 hours values displayed for the sprint (not started, in progress & done)-> only "tasks" hours are summed up here.. so subtasks hours or other itmes are not displayed, which makes this totally incorrect!

[Not summing up stories(sub-tasks) time estimates: in sprint report, velocity chart & sprint plan mode view > sprint-plan.png]

Sprint Report:

Similar error applies here. "Story" (with their sub-taksk time values) or  "New Features" (with their sub-tasks time estimates) are not summed up and displayed on the top. Neither are they displayed!

[Not summing up stories(sub-tasks) time estimates: in sprint report, velocity chart & sprint plan mode view > sprint-report.png]

Velocity Chart:

Similar problem here. "Stories".. with their subtasks time estimates & "New Featurues" between other are not summed up.(getting here 9h or 20h as total amount of hours in the sprint when it should be above 100h!)

This makes impossible to track the amount of hours delivered in a sprint! (big problem)

[Not summing up stories(sub-tasks) time estimates: in sprint report, velocity chart & sprint plan mode view > velocity.png]

Please, solve these features are not useful at all currently!

-Impossible to know total amount of hours delivered in every sprint.

-Neither being possible to follow amount of hours done in current sprint (incorrect sprint reports)

->SAME ERROR APPLIES TO "sprint health gadget" in Dashboard.. do not display correct amount of work done %

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11345].
  {panel}

The current Behaviour of a Scrum Sprint JIRA Agile for Closed ticket right now is:
* when a ticket included in a future sprint and get closed before the sprint is started, it would be still included when the Sprint Master started the sprint then it shows up in the Plan Mode.
* if a ticket is closed while a sprint is currently running, the issue key of the ticket will be having a strike through and the ticket still shown in the Plan Mode, including the closed ticket above.

Actually, there is no need to include a ticket that have been closed to a future sprint as it does not need to be worked anymore and the Sprint Master should know about it. But, since the issue will be gone in the Plan Mode if it is closed before Sprint is started, it could be hard to know that there is actually a closed ticket in the sprint. Hence, a notification or a simple behaviour to handle the closed ticket in a future sprint could be useful like:
* A warning notification that will be pop-up before starting a sprint telling that a closed ticket is inside.
* the closed ticket is removed from the sprint and the backlog.
* to still shows closed ticket same as the behaviour of a closed ticket in a running sprint.
fields.summary: Improve How JIRA Agile Handle Closed Ticket in a Future Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

If you create an Epic Issue through JIRA, all the fields you define for the issue creation screen will show up fine.

If on the other hand, you try to create an Epic in the Epic panel from inside an Agile board, only 4 fields will show up, and you will need to open the field configuration drop down to show the fields you need.

h3. Expected behaviour

Use the screen you've configured to create Epics in JIRA Agile as well, not a different screen.
fields.summary: Create Epic in JIRA Agile should use the same fields as JIRA

fields.description:
The chart line is not visible on the Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget due to the legend. This happens when gadget is present in the small column of the gadget, as in the attached picture.

This is a problem for us, because it prevents showing the chart properly in our dashboards and wallboards. 

The legend could be removed at all, or an option could be added in gadget options for showing or not showing the legend.
fields.summary: The chart line is not visible on the Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget due to the legend

fields.description:
Workflow: We use standard issues to define new features, bugs, enhancements, and tasks. Most standard issues are further broken down into sub-tasks that various team members work on. We're looking to JIRA Agile to give us a better window into the status of any one of our sprints. 

Initially, we configured our sprint board swimlanes to use stories. This provides the cleanest representation of our sprint backlog. However, we also need to be able to transition the standard issue through workflow. Currently, this cannot be done on the JIRA Agile work board via drag and drop if the standard issue contains sub-tasks. In addition, the work board does not depict the status of the standard issue if it contains sub-tasks.

It would be very helpful to be able to do the following even when using stories as swimlanes.

# visualize which column the standard issue when it has sub-tasks
# drag the standard issue to the appropriate column to transition through workflow
fields.summary: When using stories for swimlanes it would be helpful if you can drag the standard issue across columns to transition it through workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11339].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a JIRA Service Desk project
# Create a user, assign appropriate permissions to browse, edit and schedule the project. Do not assign the user as an agent.
# Create a board, create some issues
# Rank the issues

h3. Actual results

On the planning board, JIRA Agile throws an error message popup:

bq. Error: You cannot perform this operation because you do not have "Schedule" permission.

h3. Expected results

Since JIRA already knows that JIRA Service Desk has overridden the permission (user must be an agent to perform agent operations, can confirm by using JIRA permission helper), 
JIRA Agile should throw this error message, instead of problems with "Schedule" permission, which is not true.
fields.summary: Misleading error message thrown on planning board when user is not a Service Desk agent

fields.description:
Story A, has task 1. Task 1 has 4h remaining.
Story A is broken up into Story A and story B mid-sprint, but scope does not change (New story, B, is added.  Story A is modified.)
Task 1 is moved from Story A to Story B

Expected: Report board shows no change in overall remaining time estimate

Actual: Report board reports 4 hours increase in overall remaining time estimate


Attached screenshot shows entries from the history log below the Report board.  It shows 3 tasks were added to a story, and shows an increase in time remaining for each.  There are no entries showing a decrease for the tasks being removed from their previous story.  Instead of recording a "move" with no change in hours, hours were doubled for each task that was moved.
fields.summary: Moving tasks between 2 stories, both of which are in the current sprint, causes burn up

fields.description:

h3. Expected behaviour

fields.summary: Show dates in the 'x' axis of the Release Burndown and Epic Burndown charts

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

Currently the Epic Burndown forecast tool requires at least 3 sprints to calculate the values and actually show the forecast.

h3. Expected behaviour

Since there is a Velocity report which measures the same values, the Epic burndown could query for the existing data in the Velocity Report to calculate the Forecast, since the velocity of the team will be the same independent of what they work on.
fields.summary: Forecast from Epic Burndown should integrate with Velocity Report

fields.description:
As kanban rapidboard users, we want the configuration option to have swimlanes by Epic SO THAT we can easily indulge in that very useful view if we want to.

Notes:
- Swimlanes by Epic are already in Scrum mode, but deliberately supressed on the kanban board.  I understand the blah blah reasons, but not accepting of those reasons.  Even just for consistency / minimising confusion it should be there.
- Plenty of teams may have a primary Scrum board (and even then because it's the only view which provides a Plan/triage view).  And those teams may also use Kanban boards for other purposes - but confusingly aren't able to use the useful Epic data that it available.
- Sure, workaround is available by manually configuring swimlanes by specific Epic, but that's really arduous to setup, maintain and sequence.
fields.summary: As kanban rapidboard users, we also want the option to have swimlanes by Epic

fields.description:
We have a large Jira installation with Agile where different customers have access. Naturally they mustn't see any information except for the projects where they have at least browse permission.

With the current Agile setup it is easy to make mistakes regarding the visibility of boards. Once the base for the board is a filter that is shared with anyone, even people that don't have access to a project get to know that there's a board "Customer XY Kanban Board" or such.

I understand that filters can span more than one project, so my suggestion would be that the user is guided with hints (or sensible defaults).
* When creating a new board from a saved filter (visible for everyone) that contains "project = X" as restriction there should be a hint that the recommended share level is with project only. I would be OK with Jira changing the visibility of the filter to project only after a popup asking for agreement.
* When changing the filter for an existing board the same recommendations should occur.

Alternatively:
Maybe Agile should get a full-featured permission management where (independently of filter) the visibility and other permissions can be configured.
fields.summary: Visibility of Agile Boards

fields.description: When trying to prioritise a large backlog in plan mode, it's easy to lose track of the current position of an issue. Adding a relative number to each issue (ie this issue is number 156 in the list) would help provide a visual point of reference when moving through the list. As well as come back to a location faster
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I'd like to see a numerical rank in Plan mode

fields.description:
In JIRA, the [estimate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue#LoggingWorkonanIssue-originalestimateSpecifyingtimeestimates] term means the time estimates on an issue. 

In JIRA Agile, the term [estimate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking] means a measure of the size/complexity of the task. The same term used differently in different contexts is confusing for the customers. 


We need to pick different terms for JIRA and JIRA Agile so that customers don't get confused with these terms.
fields.summary: Term "Estimation" means different things in JIRA and Agile world

fields.description:
According to [JRA-5225], subtasks do not inherit Fix Versions of parents when Fix Versions are updated, and vice-versa. Because of this, sometimes parents have Fix Versions but subtasks do not (created without Fix Versions). This causes confusion to users who work on subtasks, and there's a chance that they will update subtasks with Fix Versions which do not follow parents'.

Suggestion is to be able to easily hide subtasks' Fix Versions in Agile boards. Currently this can be done by using Field Configurations, but once the field is hidden, subtasks no longer appear in Kanban boards as the default Work Sub-filter will filter them out - Hidden is not treated as Empty.

The only feasible workaround is to manually adjust the Work Sub-filter to include subtasks.
fields.summary: Hide subtasks' Fix Versions without interfering with Work Sub-filter

fields.description: The Sprint field added by the agile plugin is not searchable via the basic search interface. It is searchable via the advanced interface but that is more time consuming and lesss intuitive.

I tried to use the 'Customizing Cards' area when configuring my board, but when I add 'Remaining Hours' field to a card, it shows 'none' on the parent ticket instead of a summary.

Acceptance Criteria:
I can see the summation of all subtasks' remaining hours on the User Story on the scrum board.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to show the User Story's remaining hours as a summation of the subtasks remaining hours on the scrum board so I can quickly see at a glance the remaining hours for a story.

((status = "1-Identify and Select" or status = 2-Analyze or status = "3-Generating Potential Solutions") and ("Risk Score" >10 and "Risk Score" <=15)) or ((status = "4-Selecting and Planning Solution" or status = "5-Implementing Solution") and ("Risk Score" > 15))

fields.description:
In Version report, users can see both Epics and standard Issues, but there's no way to categorize or reorder them. It looks like that issues are automatically ordered according to the order in which they are added to the version.

This is inflexible and makes it hard for users to track the version's progress, especially when there're a lot of epics and issues. It would be easier if issues can be grouped by epics and there're more options to sort them i.e. to make it a better hierarchy.

Other than that, users might need the ability to add/remove columns to be displayed e.g. assignee, resolution. It's good if they can also see the percentage of completion of every epic so that they don't have to switch between Epic report and Version report so often.
fields.summary: Version Report should be customizable

fields.description:
A customer was confused by this error message showing on his board: "Due to the configuration for this particular board, you'll have to use the full dialog to create a new issue. Learn more" 

Apparently this displays if there are no projects or issue types detected, which is most likely due to the board's filter filtering them out.

The Learn more links to a general page on Configuring boards, but I think we should be more specific in the error message. Suggested text:
"You will need to use the full dialog to create a new issue, as your board's filter is excluding all projects and/or issue types."
fields.summary: Improve the "Due to the configuration for this particular board, you'll have to use the full dialog to create a new issue.Learn more" error message

fields.description:
The normal JIRA view issue screen provides the "Share Issue" button (assuming the user has share rights and outgoing mail has been configured).
Could this share issue button also get added in the preview panel in the plan/work boards?
fields.summary: Share issue button in issue preview

fields.description:
Client Description:


I just created a new project in our instance of JIRA, called Product Backlog (project key = PB) and we have over 60 issues in the project backlog. However, none of the issues in the project backlog show up in the Plan view for JIRA Agile. 

I have already checked to ensure that no quick filters are applied, issues are not in a "resolved" status that would preclude them from appearing. The workflow and issue type schemes are reused in other projects where issues do appear. I also switched the permission scheme to one that is shared and that did not help with the issues not appearing, so I don't think it's permissions.

I can run a query and see a list of issues so I know they're hiding in the project somewhere, but I'd love for them to show up in the plan view so that I can adjust priority from there, etc.

h2. Workaround:

When you create a scrum project and only have one column in your Work view, it causes all issues to be hidden in the Plan view. You must have at least two columns in the Work view (scrum board) in order for issues to show up in planning.
fields.summary: No tickets are showing up on the Plan view for JIRA Agile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11263].
{panel}
When a JIRA Agile board is deleted, all sprints that are active on it cannot be deleted nor can reports from them be viewed.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a new Scrum Board
 # Create a sprint on the board and add issues.
 # Start the sprint.
 # Delete the board.
 # Sprint stays active and cannot be ended and report page is blank.
Active sprints from deleted boards are still displayed in the 'Sprint' field suggestions too, which may be confusing for the users.

*Expected behaviour*
When a user attempts to delete a board, show a notification about the active sprints and let them choose to either complete or remove the sprints, or keep them active.

*Workaround*
 # If there are issues associated with the sprints:
 ** Create a new board.
 ** Associate the filter of deleted board to new board.
 ** You can now end sprint from this board.
 # If there are no issues associated with the affected sprints:
 ** Create a test project
 ** Show sprint field on the field configuration of the test project
 ** Create new issue, associate with this new issue
 ** Create new board
 ** Associate test project with the board
 ** Now you can end the sprint from this board

(i) Although you can manually update the table to remove the board, but it is not recommended.
the sprints will need to be deleted with a manual update of the "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" table.

This sprint was showing up because it wasn't marked as closed, but the board it was on had been deleted.
{noformat}
jira=# select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT";
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE |   END_DATE    | ID |     NAME      | RAPID_VIEW_ID | STARTED |  START_DATE
--------+---------------+---------------+----+---------------+---------------+---------+---------------

fields.summary: After a Board Is Deleted, Related Sprints Remain Active

fields.description:
When we create a sprint retrospective page through the "Linked pages" on the Sprint report page on a Jira Agile board, we can only choose the Confluence Space and not a parent page within the Confluence Space in the wizard. And therefore we always have to move the page created to a different parent page. It would be far more efficient to be able to choose the parent page within the Confluence Space selected.

Can this be implemented?
fields.summary: Possibility to select parent page in confluence space when creating linked page from Sprint report

fields.description:
This method is intended to be a lightweight check of the number of existing issues and the maximum updated timestamp, but it can actually be quite expensive.  From a NewRelic profile taken by an enterprise customer:

!WorkDataFactoryPermissions.png!

This doesn't really need to check permissions, because the nastiest thing that can happen is that we leak information that some issue would be on their agile board if only they could see it.  It seems strange that a developer wouldn't have permission to see issues on their board in the first place, so filtering the count and last updated timestamp seems unnecessary, here.
fields.summary: WorkDataFactory.getWorkDataIssueCountAndLastUpdated does not need to check permissions

fields.description: As a Scrum Master, I would like the ability to change swimlanes with the click of a button to see progress of the Sprint from different perspectives. E.g. when trying to see how much progress each member of my team has made in their assigned tasks, I use the "Assignee" swimlane. When looking at the progress of a Story, I use the "Story" swimlane. It would be nice to be able to quickly change swimlanes to get different perspectives without having to create multiple boards or having to reconfigure the board.
fields.summary: Rapid board should have the ability to quickly change swimlanes

fields.description:
When customers with large instances are running an upgrade, some upgrade tasks can take a long time and no status for the task is logged.

This can cause users to think the upgrade is actually stuck as there's no indication that anything is happening or how long it's going to take.

It would be great if JIRA Agile could estimate how long the upgrade task will take at the beginning and every few minutes log a message showing it is still running and a new estimate for tasks that will take a long time.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like JIRA to estimate how long an upgrade task will take

fields.description:
As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to customise the Start and End date formats for a sprint without changing the general JIRA date-time pickers.

Current options for customising the Start and End Date formats for a sprint would be 
* Customise date-time picker formats in the {{jira-config.properties}} - but this side effect for this is that all date/date-time pickers will be affected by this change.
* A second option would be to use Javascript injection using the Announcement Banner, which is quite messy.

It would be nice to have a setting in {{jira-config.properties}} to change only JIRA Agile sprint date-time pickers to use a custom format like "Year-Month-Day 00:00" using Java/Javascript date format specifiers to avoid JIRA-wide changes.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to customise the Start and End date formats for a sprint without affecting JIRA date-time pickers

fields.summary: get an error when I try to bulk update issues to a new sprint

fields.description: Two projects have the same sprint number. When the label is edited in one project, the label changes in the other. So in two different projects these sprints cannot have different labels.
fields.summary: Sprint label changes on one project when another sprint is edited

fields.description:
As a JIRA user, I would like to see my sprint burndown chart based on number of subtasks.
We are using story points as estimates, but in a sprint we have only few storys with many tasks. The current burndown based on story points is useless, because we don't want to add story points to the tasks. The burndown shows only few steps as we are resolving our tickets. If we could see the number of remaining tickets in our sprint, we would have an accurate burndown, similar what we had in classic greenhopper.
fields.summary: Burndown chart for number of subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11248].
  {panel}

1. Create version that has an "&" inside it (i.e. 1.4 & 1.5)
2. Assign a user story to that version
3. The story will show "1.4 & 1.5" as it's version.
I tried it three times now and got the same result. Seems like every "&" gets displayed as an "&"
In the screen shoot you can see that after the & you will see &amp.
fields.summary: "&" shows up as a "&" inside Jira Agile version label

fields.description:
h1. Introduction
We are happily using your Agile plugin for years now and it is always a perfect fit and of great help to our agile development process.

There is just one thing that we are not able to match with our development process and that is (in our opinion) not structured correctly in JIRA Agile. Currently epics are not displayed in the backlog, but in the left EPIC bar. We would prefer to change this so that epics are displayed in the product backlog and the left bar is called differently (ie. "theme" would suit better).

h1. Why?
# An epic should not contain user stories as it actually is a big user story. Later on the epic is replaced by several user stories.
# An epic should be estimated to the same reference as a user story (if story x is 5 story points, than epic y is 100 story points)
# An epic should be prioritised accurately, so in between story 3 and story 4 of theme 1, it should be possible to place epic 1 of theme 2. By prioritizing the epics seperately from the other PBI's you suggest that you first need to finish an epic (or what we would call theme) before you start another.

h1. Solution
What we would like to change is:
# Add a new (default) issue type called "Theme"
# Change the left bar from epic to theme, so that you can still group backlog items and easily filter them.
# Put the actual epics back where they belong, in the backlog together with all other PBI's

We sincerely hope that you can help us out with this issue in some way as it concerns the foundations of how we structure our projects.

Thanks, also on behalf of our development teams,

Kai Stevens
fields.summary: Change the way epics are handled

fields.description:
I already know about the "right click -> bulk edit" feature.

What would be useful is the _drag and drop_ bulk feaure which is available in _Plan_ mode.
fields.summary: Work mode: allow Drag  and Drop BULK transition (as in Plan mode)

fields.description:
At the moment it's possible for Users to add Issues to a Future Sprint from a different board. This causes a single sprint to be started on multiple boards with no indication that it's the same Sprint.

*How to Reproduce*
# Create 2 projects A and B both with separate Rapid Boards
# Create a planned Sprint on board A called Sprint Alpha
# Create a planned Sprint on board B called Sprint Beta
# Drag an issue on board A into the sprint
# Go to the *Issue View* in JIRA for an issue in Project B
# Edit the Sprint field, select Sprint Alpha (note that it does NOT warn you it's from a different project)
# Sprint Alpha will now appear on the Scrum board for Project B
# Start the Sprint in Board A
# The Sprint will now also be active in Board B
# Closing one sprint closes the other as well

There are a few results of this
* You need Project Admin for both boards to be able to start the sprint
* There is no indication on either board the Sprint contains issues from another board. Both boards act like it's their own contained sprint.
* Ending a sprint on one board requires Project Admin for both projects
* It LOOKS like sharing the same name causing sprints to be linked however it's the same sprint in both boards.

*Possible Solutions*
* Warn the user that the future sprint is from a different board
* Warn the user when starting a new sprint that it contains issues from a different board

*Workaround*
* Only assign Issues to Sprints from the Rapid Board
fields.summary: Users should be warned if a Sprint is started with issues from a different Board

fields.description:
After the update of JIRA Agile from 6.3.9.1 to 6.6.0, the "Rank" field was re-worked into a new Lexo rank field and the original field was re-named to "Rank (Obsolete)" as explained in the upgrade notes at : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.4+Upgrade+Notes.

Although it is safe to remove this field later, but the customer needs to go through the process of removing the field through the database. The upgrade process should automatically take care of deleting the field.
fields.summary: Rank (obsolete) fields should be unlocked so that they can be deleted

If subtasks exist in an issue, we estimate only these ones and not the parrent issue.
When I check the "epic report", the Original Time Estimate is 0 for the issue and this issue is counted for one unestimated issue ! (see attached file)

It could be really useful to have the addition of estimate values of each sub task in the report, like we can do when the parent issue is showed in the time tracking part (see attached file)

fields.description:
As the administrator of a large instance, I have hundreds of agile boards to oversee.  Many of these boards are old, unused or were created by users to test something and then abandoned.

I would like a way to see the usage of each board (either by last date accessed or by number of users accessing the board) so that I can better determine at a glance if a board is active or inactive.

fields.description:
Control Chart is really good at giving us statistics, but we miss one important feature. We'd like to get data for a certain selection of the issues - for example to be able to get statistics for one special customer (where we have a customer custom field) 

Quick filters and swimlane support is not enough since we cannot create a new quick filter for each customer we have. Functionality needs to be more flexible - for example with a JQL query field (as a refinement filter). 

Issue could also be related to GHS-4288 but I'd prefer to avoid exporting to Excel.
fields.summary: As a control chart user I can refine the selection of issues with a JQL query

fields.description:
Currently, the Version Report in JIRA Agile allows user to choose one version from the version dropdown. This restricts the report for only one version at a time. 

Same goes to the Burndown Chart. If user have multiple Sprints running, the chart can only show one Sprint at a time.

Having the ability to choose multiple versions and display them into one report would be helpful.
fields.summary: Aggregate JIRA Agile Version Report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11209].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

This affects JIRA versions *6.3.4 and higher*, _regardless_ of the JIRA Agile version installed.

When viewing Agile boards in plan mode, by expanding the Versions session it is possible to click on the Description field to make it turn into a text box. After entering some value and hitting <enter> it looks like the description has been updated, however, when we refresh the page it gets back to the old value (or empty if there was no description before).

!before_changes.png!
!mouseover_description.png!
!description_entered.png!
!after_changes.png!

h3. Work around

Please edit version data through the Versions page in Project Administration.
fields.summary: Version name and Description fields are editable but they don’t save changes on Agile plan mode

fields.description: A sprint's scope change should stored as a flag on a custom field so it can be easily searched for using JQL.
fields.summary: Scope changes should be stored on a field

fields.description:
The goal is for a Product Manager who is planning a future release to be able to focus in on and prioritize the set of epics that have the Targeted Release (custom field) set to the release they are interested in.

Ideally they could grey out the epics they are not interested in. Unfortunately the only way to affect the Epics in the UI appears to be by using the fixVersion field, which is not the field we use in early planning.

For example: 

!grey-out-epics.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As an user, I would like to grey out Epics after click on the quick filter.

fields.description:
For example, the Control Chart cannot be disabled or hide.

Certain company might not allow certain type of measurement to take place.
fields.summary: Having the option to disable report that is not used by team

fields.description:
Hi JIRA Agile team,

The new feature released is great. It helps us a lot. But it will helps us even better if you guys implement the possibility to configure card layout by issue type.

Why this is important for us... Cause we use KANBAN boards for specific teams over here. One for Project Team, one for Support Team, one for Product Team and another one for the DEV Team.

According to our workflows one issue can pass from one KANBAN to other, due to its status or even its type.

Each KANBAN has a different focus and we believe its issues should have different visible informations as well.

An issue type of *DEV Task*, for example, should expose the information below as its extra fields:
- Due Date
- Original Estimate
- Time Spent.

On the other hand, an issue type of *Customer Request Support* should expose the information below as its extra fields:
- Responsible Support Attendant
- SLA related to Time to Respond

Hope your considerations. Regardless of all mentioned above. Congrats for the new feature, it's very useful! :)
fields.summary: It will be great if in the new feature: Configure Card Layout, I could make the configuration by issue type

fields.description:
The 6.6.0 Agile boards added the 'Workload by assignee' table, which is amazing and should solve a lot of our problems regarding dealing with specialists on the boards.

We use Original Time Estimate as our primary estimation statistic, as opposed to Story points.

I need this tool to tell me how much time people are taking on in to the sprint, NOT how much the issue had assigned to it in total. 

If I had a ticket with a 2 day estimate that rolled over from the previous sprint with 4 hours remaining on it, then that's only 4 hours that individual has on them in them in the next sprint - that's the information I need to be able to see.

Set this as a blocker because this is absolutely key to our workflow and will prevent us moving from the classic boards.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I need workload by assignee in Remaining Time Estimate, not Original Time Estimate

fields.description:
Where I have a need for 3 separate quick filters, all variants on status, I have buttons for "Resolved and Closed" "Closed" and "Resolved not Closed" for instance.
These could far more logically be presented as a set of choices in a drop down, with the addition of "Not applied" or "None" etc. Each choice would simply be a different quick filter definition and description. This would also ensure the control was actually displaying the state being applied, rather than the current, somewhat confusing highlighting where the single description can lead to misinterpretation.
By extension the control would need a descriptive title as well.
One could envisage 3 customers being important for now, so a 'Customer' title control would have 'All', 'Cust1','Cust2','Cust5' for instance relating to 3 separate, very similar quick filter queries. 
This would significantly reduce clutter, and would even help with single On Off type quick filters, where description would change.
An advantage of this approach is not having to link the quick filters to lookup selectors, and additionally, the drop down could even use very dissimilar quick filters at the same time if required.
fields.summary: Enhance Quick Filter display and capabilities

fields.description: As a admin user, I'd like to be able to configure email notification per sprints.
fields.summary: Configure email notification per sprint

fields.description:
When planning issues for a sprint, the estimeted time showed on the card, does only show the estimate time of the parent issue. If a parent has subtasks, the time estimated for these subtasks is not included in the card of the parent.

On issue level you are able to switch on/off the totale estimated time of parents and subtask. These should also be vissible on the cards on the board in order to pla correctly.
fields.summary: Show total estimate time including subtasks on card
